item.title: Uses
item.description: I use both, Linux and Windows+WSL. Preferred Instant Messenger / Chat Signal Search Engine Brave search Google Browsers Brave Firefox w3m Editor Neovim Notepad++ (for minor stuff) Desktop Environment i3

item.title: Software Development Skills
item.description: I feel there is more to being a good software enginner than knowing the programming language (and DB/UI) alone. The other ones being (in no particular order): Thinking in abstractions. Finding patterns. Taking a step backwards and looking at the bigger picture. Clarity of thought. Knowing the business purpose of the feature/change request. Good written communication. Knowing the developer tools well. Using the (right) developer tools. Curiosity. Identifying what assumptions to verify (specially while debugging).

item.title: Projects
item.description: Web-VQD (A Visual SQL Query Builder) A web-based code-generator utility for visually designing SQL SELECT queries. I used to work on MS Access and was pretty impressed by the drag-n-drop query builder which it had. I couldn’t find a similar tool for MySQL. Hence, I tried building this. Stack: Backbone.js PHP MySQL Demo
